Maragaret,
 
The reason I extend an invitation to new people to contact me=
 off group if they wish,
Is for two reasons, the first most new people tend=
 to be shy and reserved and intimidated when it comes to asking public ques=
tions
most feel that their questions may be viewed as silly or not deservin=
g of serious explination. I have encountered many instances like this.
It j=
ust helps them to take the first couple of steps if they feel they are in a=
 confidential environment.
 
Also, I tend to be very long winded in my resp=
onses and answers with explinations, and I don't think that the more experi=
enced 
members here that have heard it all before care to hear a three para=
graph post on why you should use the 470 instead of the 469.
 
I am always =
available on and off board to answer any and all questions I am able.
 
Bru=
ce
Bruce Halliday 


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: ITCdeadpeople@...=
Date: Sun, 30 Mar 2008 22:18:57 +0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: EVP questions_c=
an anyone help ?




Hi Bruce. Just a thought.... It's really sweet of you =
to make yourself so available to people, but if you have members take inqui=
ries of this nature off the boards by having them contact your privately, y=
ou are limiting the amount of learning that can take place. There are likel=
y "lurkers" here, who will never join or come forward, but could really ben=
efit from Lyn's questions and the answers she receives from the group. Taki=
ng communication privately also eliminates the possibility for her to recei=
ve multiple opinions. (not to imply there isn't a time for privacy!) ;0)Lik=
e I said, just a thought. Margaret--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, bruce hal=
liday <paranormalinvestigating@...> wrote:>> > Lyn,> > I would be happy to =
help you and answer any questions you have.> you can e-mail me if you like>=
 > paranormalinvestigating@...> > any time> Bruce> Bruce Halliday > > > To:=
 EVP-ITC@...: ITCdeadpeople@...: Sun, 30 Mar 2008 20:09:51 +0000Subject: [E=
VP-ITC] Re: EVP questions_can anyone help ?> > > > > Hi Lyn. I'm sure sever=
al of us here could help you. What are your questions? Margaret--- In EVP-I=
TC@yahoogroups.com, "Lyn" <angels4lyn@> wrote:>> HI> I'm one of the quiet m=
embers here. trying to learn from everyone.> I have activity in my home. so=
 I purchased an RCA digital recorder> which is amazing.> I have captured se=
veral EVPs, some quite clear, some a bit too fast> so I slow it down to hea=
r it. some are voices , some answer questions, some > are just noises.> > d=
oes anyone have experience with EVPs on digital recorders ?> I have a ton o=
f questions... and need advice on some of them.> > thanks> Lyn> angels4lyn@=
> > > > > > > > __________________________________________________________>=
 In a rush? Get real-time answers with Windows Live Messenger.> http://www.=
windowslive.com/messenger/overview.html?ocid=3DTXT_TAGLM_WL_Refresh_realtim=
e_042008>

Maragaret,<BR>
 <BR>
The reason I extend an invitation to =
new people to contact me off group if they wish,<BR>
Is for two reasons, th=
e first most new people tend to be shy and reserved and intimidated when it=
 comes to asking public questions<BR>
most feel that their questions may be=
 viewed as silly or not deserving of serious explination. I have encountere=
d many instances like this.<BR>
It just helps them to take the first couple=
 of steps if they feel they are in a confidential environment.<BR>
 <B=
R>
Also, I tend to be very long winded in my responses and answers with exp=
linations, and I don't think that the more experienced <BR>
members here th=
at have heard it all before care to hear a three paragraph post on why you =
should use the 470 instead of the 469.<BR>
 <BR>
I am always available=
 on and off board to answer any and all questions I am able.<BR>
 <BR>=

Bruce<BR><BR><BR>
